subtitle: Hope VI and the new promise of public housing in America's cities
title: From despair to hope
by_statement: Henry G. Cisneros and Lora Engdahl, editors.

description.value: "Documents the evolution of HOPE VI, exploring what it accomplished replacing severely distressed public housing with mixed-income communities and where it fell short. Reveals how a program conceived to address a specific problem triggered a revolution in public housing and solidified principles that still guide urban policy today"--Provided by publisher.
